intro: Hypoporum interruptum, commonly known as the interrupted hypoporum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive shape with a serrated margin. Hypoporum interruptum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
